alert.note: Alert for Saint Croix; Saint John; Saint Thomas (Virgin Islands) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued November 17 at 5:17PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...ISOLATED FLOODING STILL POSSIBLE ACROSS PUERTO RICO AND THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS DURING THE WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK... As Potential Tropical Cyclone Twenty-Two moves northeast, a moist southerly wind flow will prevail across the local islands through early the next workweek. This will result in periods of showers and thunderstorms across the local islands, particularly for portions of the south and east sections of Puerto Rico, as well as Vieques, Culebra and the U.S. Virgin Islands. Based on latest guidance, a 5-day rainfall totals between 2 and 4 inches with isolated higher amounts is possible across these areas. Elsewhere, the potential exists for rainfall totals to exceed 1 to 2 inches. Therefore, there is a risk for ponding of water, flooding of urban areas, roads and small streams. Isolated life threatening flash flooding and mudslides are possible as well. Some rivers will likely overflow their banks. Since widespread flooding is not expected at this time, a Flash Flood Watch will not be issued at this time. This product will be updated as needed.

area.areaDesc: Saint Croix; Saint John; Saint Thomas
